result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Letter requesting to move the time for the Jury Status on 11-17-2022 filed by Attorney Katie Babe;  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-31-2022:  granted - ok to reset to another time, also check on status of trial.

8:30 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe appeared by video for Jesse Michael Bemis. 
Defendant Jesse Michael Bemis appeared by video.  
Case to tag along with 22CF0624.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:03 AM    File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jesse Michael Bemis in court by zoom with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Babe requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Comply with all conditions in Waukesha Count case: 22CF624 as follows:  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:35 AM Defendant Jesse Michael Bemis in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
